anyOf.description: Name for and, optionally, path to the private key. You can either use an existing RSA or DSA key that you own or create a new private key on the Citrix ADC. This file is required only when creating a self-signed Root-CA certificate. The key file is stored in the /nsconfig/ssl directory by default.
anyOf.title: Private Key File Name

anyOf.description: Name of and, optionally, path to the X509 certificate file that is used to form the certificate-key pair. /nsconfig/ssl/ is the default path.
anyOf.title: Private Key File Name

notificationPeriod.description: Time, in number of days, before certificate expiration, at which to generate an alert that the certificate is about to expire
notificationPeriod.title: Notification Period (Days)

privateKeyFormat.description: Format in which the key is stored on the appliance
privateKeyFormat.title: Private Key Format

certificateKeyPairName.description: Name for the certificate and private-key pair
certificateKeyPairName.title: Certificate-Key Pair Name

notifyExpiration.description: Whether to alert when the certificate is about to expire
notifyExpiration.title: Notify When Expires

certificateRequestFileName.description: Name for and, optionally, path to the certificate-signing request (CSR). /nsconfig/ssl/ is the default path.
certificateRequestFileName.title: Certificate Request File Name

anyOf.description: The name of the incoming field containing the binary file data to be processed
anyOf.title: Input Data Field Name

anyOf.description: The name of the output field to put the binary file data in
anyOf.title: Put Output in Field

password.description: Input format of the certificate and the private-key files. The three formats supported by the appliance are: PEM - Privacy Enhanced Mail DER - Distinguished Encoding Rule PFX - Personal Information Exchange.
password.title: Password

caPrivateKeyFileName.description: Private key, associated with the CA certificate that is used to sign the Intermediate-CA certificate or the end-user client and server certificate. If the CA key file is password protected, the user is prompted to enter the pass phrase that was used to encrypt the key.
caPrivateKeyFileName.title: CA Private Key File Name

certificateBundle.description: Whether to parse the certificate chain as a single file after linking the server certificate to its issuer's certificate within the file
certificateBundle.title: Certificate Bundle

fileName.description: Name of the file. It should not include filepath.
fileName.title: File Name

anyOf.description: Format in which the certificate is stored on the appliance
anyOf.title: Certificate Format

anyOf.description: Input format of the certificate and the private-key files. The three formats supported by the appliance are: PEM - Privacy Enhanced Mail DER - Distinguished Encoding Rule PFX - Personal Information Exchange.
anyOf.title: Certificate Format

caCertificateFileName.description: Name of the CA certificate file that issues and signs the Intermediate-CA certificate or the end-user client and server certificates
caCertificateFileName.title: CA Certificate File Name

caSerialFileNumber.description: Serial number file maintained for the CA certificate. This file contains the serial number of the next certificate to be issued or signed by the CA.
caSerialFileNumber.title: CA Serial File Number

subjectaltname.description: Subject Alternative Name (SAN) is an extension to X.509 that allows various values to be associated with a security certificate using a subjectAltName field
subjectaltname.title: Subject Alternative Name

days.description: Number of days for which the certificate will be valid, beginning with the time and day (system time) of creation
days.title: Validity Period (Number of Days)

anyOf.description: Name for and, optionally, path to the private key. You can either use an existing RSA or DSA key that you own or create a new private key on the Citrix ADC. This file is required only when creating a self-signed Root-CA certificate. The key file is stored in the /nsconfig/ssl directory by default.
anyOf.title: PEM Passphrase (For Encrypted Key)

anyOf.description: Name for and, optionally, path to the private key. You can either use an existing RSA or DSA key that you own or create a new private key on the Citrix ADC. This file is required only when creating a self-signed Root-CA certificate. The key file is stored in the /nsconfig/ssl directory by default.
anyOf.title: PEM Passphrase (For Encrypted CA Key)

fileName.description: Name of the file. It should not include filepath.
fileName.title: File Name

anyOf.description: Name for and, optionally, path to the generated certificate file. /nsconfig/ssl/ is the default path.
anyOf.title: Certificate File Name

anyOf.description: Name of and, optionally, path to the X509 certificate file that is used to form the certificate-key pair. /nsconfig/ssl/ is the default path.
anyOf.title: Certificate File Name
